title: Yad (Torah pointer)
text: The person reading a Torah always uses a yad (Hebrew for "hand"), or Torah pointer, to keep his or her place, because touching the parchment with fingers causes the ink to deteriorate.
description: wand; hand with pointing index figure at narrow end; chain attached at knob end; rolled design
provenance: (Weisberg Religious Articles, New York, NY); Collection of Harold & Mickey Smith purchased 2/12/87; Gift to the MIA in 1998
creditline: Gift of Harold and Mickey Smith
